fetchr.error.command_blocks_disabled: Command blocks are disabled on this server. Please make sure the server.properties file does have all mentioned values set as described %s.
fetchr.setup.error.unknown_category: Item %1$s has category %2$s, but category %2$s could not be found.
fetchr.actionbar.wrong_resourcepack_erro: Incompatible version of the Fetchr resource pack enabled.
fetchr.resourcepack_check.go_to_lobby.pa: The resource pack was successfully enabled.
You are using an incompatible version of the Fetchr resource pack.

Please download the correct version %s, enable it and click “re-check” down below.
If the resource pack was applied automatically through a server resource pack, please inform the server admin to update it.
fetchr.game.menu.heading: Fetchr Menu
fetchr.game.menu.hint: Hint: You can click %s anywhere to bring up the Fetchr menu. You may also run %s manually, replacing %s with the auto-completable action.
fetchr.game.switch_gamemode.prevented:
Prevented game mode switch. %s for spectator mode.
Afterwards, you can switch to any other game mode.
fetchr.game.switch_gamemode.hint:
Hint: You can use the command %s at any time manually to switch to spectator mode as well.
If you do not like this functionality, you can disable it in your preferences in the lobby.
fetchr.preferences.title: Change Preferences
fetchr.preferences.description: This menu allows you to configure your own preferences.
fetchr.preferences.custom_hud.title: Configure Fetchr HUD
fetchr.preferences.custom_hud.descriptio: In this menu, you can move components of the custom HUD around, disable them, or adjust some component-specific settings.
fetchr.preferences.spectator_mode.title: Prevent manual game mode switching
fetchr.preferences.spectator_mode.descri:
When on, you will not be able to use /gamemode commands, F3+N or F3+F4 to switch your game mode while in game.

This is done to prevent accidentally hitting those button combinations.

There is a chat message you can use for switching to spectator mode instead. After switching to spectator mode or getting all 25 items on the card, you can switch your game mode freely again.
fetchr.preferences.custom_hud.add_disabl: Here, you can view disabled components and add them somewhere to your HUD.
You currently have all components enabled.
Adds the component to the display slot.
Cannot add component to this slot, as there is no space left.
fetchr.preferences.custom_hud.adjust_col: Here, you can switch positions of components, move them to a different column, or adjust component-specific settings.
There are no components which are currently in this display slot.
Moves component to the other display slot.
Switches position of this component with the above component.
Switches position of this component with the below component.
Removes the component from your HUD.
fetchr.preferences.custom_hud.adjust_car: Here, you can change settings about the bingo card.
Moves the bingo card to the left side of the hotbar.

Moves the bingo card to the right side of the hotbar without leaving space for the attack indicator.
In case “Options → Video Settings → Attack Indicator” is set to “Hotbar”, please select the other option.
Move to Right of Hotbar (Attack Indicator)

Moves the bingo card to the right side of the hotbar while leaving space for the attack indicator.
Only use this option if “Options → Video Settings → Attack Indicator” is set to “Hotbar”.
fetchr.preferences.custom_hud.component_: Seed Settings
This page allows you to customize settings for the seed display
Only show seed after run completion

With this setting, the Fetchr seed will only be revealed after a completed run.

Specifically, this means after collecting all 25 items, or after returning to the lobby.

If you want to properly disguise your spawn location, you also need to either not use F3 or set Options -> Chat Settings -> Reduced Debug Info to ON.
Always show seed
With this setting, the Fetchr seed will always be shown.
Chunk Coordinate Settings
This page allows you to customize settings for the chunk coordinate display
Show instead of position when holding treasure map

This setting removes this component from the list and instead shows the chunk coordinates in place of the normal coordinates when you are holding a treasure map.

This is useful for finding the specific block of treasure, as it's always on chunk coordinates 9 9.

Use the settings of the normal coordinates to change this back.
Coordinate Settings
This page allows you to customize settings for the coordinate display
Show chunk coordinates when holding treasure map

With this setting, chunk coordinates are shown instead of regular coordinates when holding a treasure map.

This is useful for finding the specific block of treasure, as it's always on chunk coordinates 9 9.
Enable separate chunk coordinate component

With this, the coordinates are no longer replaced by chunk coordinates when holding a treasure map, and instead a separate component with chunk coordinates is inserted if there is space.

You can of course also disable that component like any other component.
Use Compass Icon
Changes the coordinate icon to a Minecraft compass item.
Use Text Icon
Changes the coordinate icon to a textual representation of cardinal directions.
fetchr.lobby.credits.community_and_suppo: In this book, you find some useful links for support, bug reports and suggestions.
fetchr.lobby.card_generation.from_seed.i: %s to receive the command for setting the seed. Add the numeric seed at the very end of the command.
fetchr.lobby.card_generation.from_seed.e: The seed determines which items generate on the bingo card and where you spawn. You can use this for example for competitive races, where everyone is using the same seed.
fetchr.lobby.card_generation.join_game.n: The game is not ready yet. You will automatically join the game once it is.
fetchr.lobby.card_generation.join_game.e: You have to generate a card before joining a game.
You cannot join an ongoing game. If you want to start a new game, generate a new card first.
fetchr.lobby.settings.blind_mode.lectern:
In blind mode, you will not be able to see the card before or during the game.

Once a team has unlocked an item, the item will be visible to players of all teams.

Knowing mutually exclusive items will help you greatly.

Check out the category chests around the corner!
This setting change will only take effect after generating a new random card.
fetchr.lobby.settings.lockout_mode.lecte:
In lockout mode, each cell can only be obtained by one team, locking out all other teams from unlocking the item.

Your team wins either by Bingo, or when you obtained more items that any other team can.
Once a team has obtained more items than any other team still has available, the lockout race winner will be announced automatically.
fetchr.lobby.settings.lockout_mode.toggl: This setting change will only take effect after the ongoing game has completed.
fetchr.lobby.settings.points_goal.menu.s: The points race will end after %s minutes
The points race has been disabled
fetchr.lobby.settings.points_goal.lecter:
During a points race, you try to get as many items as possible in the specified time. Whoever gets the most amount of items within the time, or whoever gets a blackout the fastest, wins.

You can use this to limit the amount of time spend on a game.
Like with any other goal, there is no forced game end and you can continue playing after the race has ended, for example when you are close to a blackout.
fetchr.lobby.settings.timer_method.toggl: The timer now uses real time.
The timer now uses in-game time.
fetchr.lobby.settings.paused_time.toggle: Paused time is no longer counted by the timer.
Paused time is now counted by the timer.
fetchr.lobby.settings.timer.lectern.head: Timer Settings
fetchr.lobby.settings.timer.lectern.page:
The timer is what keeps track of your time during the game.

When using real time, the timer will keep track of time as it actually passes.

This means, one second will always be one second, no matter what.

Using in-game time, time is measured as it passes in game. Without any lag, an in-game day lasts 20 minutes.

If the game, however lags, time will pass slower in-game than usually.

Using in-game time, a Minecraft day will always be counted as 20 minutes.

Real time will put players with lower end devices who experience more lag at a disadvantage because it will take more time for nighttime to arrive and mobs to spawn.

With lag, you also might have a harder time exploring, as chunks may take longer to load in, and you might need to wait for the world to appear, while players with better computers can just move and cover ground the entire time.

Using in-game time could put players who experience lag at an advantage, as they will generally be able to explore with less time passed, especially when being at roughly the same area, for example in a cave system.
There is no “better” way to measure time, and you can try to evaluate which you consider fairer.

This setting is mostly relevant for singleplayer.

When active, the timer will keep increasing, even when the game is paused.

In multiplayer, the timer will not increase while no player is online when this setting is inactive.

By default, paused time is not counted.
fetchr.lobby.settings.operator_only.togg: Only operators can interact with game controls now.
Every player can interact with game controls now.
fetchr.lobby.settings.operator_only.lect: With this setting enabled, users will have to confirm their operator status when interacting with any game control sign, just like you had to when enabling this setting.
Game controls that are limited with this setting include generating a card, starting a game, teleporting all players, changing timer settings, or toggling blind or lockout mode.
Changing this setting, the lobby game mode, the pre-generation radius, or allowing / disallowing spectator mode and showing the seed always requires operator permissions, regardless of this setting.
fetchr.operator_only.confirm_op:
This setting is restricted to operators.
Please %s to confirm your operator status.
fetchr.operator_only.confirm_op.success: You have successfully confirmed your operator status.
Please click the sign you wanted to interact with again.
fetchr.lobby.settings.gamemode.toggle.ad: Players in the lobby now use adventure mode.
fetchr.lobby.settings.gamemode.toggle.su: Players in the lobby now use survival mode.
fetchr.lobby.settings.gamemode.lectern.p:
By default, all players in the lobby are in adventure mode, which means they cannot place or break any blocks.

In singleplayer, you are intentionally left in survival mode and allowed to alter the lobby in this way.

All essential parts like signs and lecterns are always preserved.

This can be used for nice decorations and giving the place a story from things collected from different runs.
fetchr.lobby.settings.pre_gen.menu.optio: Set to a custom amount of blocks
fetchr.lobby.settings.pre_gen.menu.error: %s is below the minimum radius of %s blocks.
fetchr.lobby.settings.pre_gen.menu.set.m: Pre-generation now only generates minimal terrain.
fetchr.lobby.settings.pre_gen.menu.set.r: A %s radius of blocks is now pre-generated before every game.
fetchr.lobby.settings.pre_gen.lectern.pa:
Pre-generation is the process of generating the terrain around spawn before the game starts.

This is useful to avoid lag spikes when exploring the world, as the terrain is already generated.

This, however, has the disadvantage that you will need to wait before starting the game for the pre-generation to be completed.

If you experience lag, you can experiment with this setting.

The default minimal setting will only generate the immediate spawn point.

This is the fastest option for wait time and comes at the disadvantage of potential lag spikes as players explore in different directions.
fetchr.lobby.settings.allow_spectating.t: Players are prevented from using spectator mode.
Players may use spectator mode now.
fetchr.lobby.settings.allow_spectating.l:
Players can usually enter spectator mode at any point during a game as a way to stop playing.

Players who cooperate could potentially abuse this to gain an advantage.
With this setting, you can disable spectator mode entirely if you are worried about players abusing spectator mode.
fetchr.lobby.settings.show_seed.toggle.o: Players no longer see the Fetchr seed during the game.
Players now see the Fetchr seed, even during the game.
Above the hotbar on the right, the Fetchr Seed is shown by default.

Generating a card with the same seed will result in the same card and spawn point.

This could be abused by players who could look at the spawn point in spectator or creative mode in singleplayer to gain an advantage.

If you are concerned about this, you can use this setting to hide the seed until the game has ended.
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.chests.lectern.pag:
The chests to the right display all the items that are in the Fetchr item pool.

Each column is a category. Only one item of each category can appear at the same time on any given card.

A column starting with an empty slot is a continuation of the category in the last column.

An item can also have multiple categories, which restricts it more, as the item can only be picked when none of the items in any of its categories are on the card.

Items can also have weights. The higher the weight is, the more likely it is for the game to pick the item from the category.

Use the sign above to re-generate the chests.
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.goals.introduction:
In Fetchr, there are different kinds of goals to go for.

The following pages detail all the goals that are detected.

You do not need to select the goal, simply keep playing until you are done.
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.goals.planning:
It is recommended to plan ahead before starting the game.

For planning the run, you can use the marking functionality on the card in the lobby. Simply use left or right click on the item frames.
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.goals.bingo:
For a bingo, get all of the 5 items in any of the rows, columns or diagonals.

If you manage to get the 5 required items without any additional items, that is called a “Sniper bingo”.
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.goals.blackout:
A blackout is simply getting all of the 25 items.

Try to be as efficient as possible, getting items from similar sources together and smelt while you are doing other stuff in the area.
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.goals.20_no_bingo:
Get 20 items without achieving any bingo.

When planning, try to think about which items to avoid in order to achieve this goal. Beware of items you might pick up accidentally, such as arrows when fighting skeletons.
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.goals.multiple_bin:
For this goal, you need to get multiple bingos at once.

This works by getting 4 items in intersecting rows, columns or diagonals, and the item at the intersection last.
This includes double, triple and quadruple bingo.
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.game_info.introduc: This book contains some general information about the game. There are some custom world generation changes, which are also detailed in here.
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.game_info.general: All the items in the game require the exact variant as pictured. All items that look the same count (i.e., an enchanted book does not require any specific enchantment, but a red bed requires the specific color).
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.game_info.game_rul:
The weather is always sunny to prevent endermen from being annoying.

Phantoms, wandering traders and pillager patrols are disabled, because those are based on a global world timer, causing issues when playing multiple runs.
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.game_info.compress:
The world has been compressed to enable easier exploration.

In particular, biome sizes have been decreased while keeping the same layout, and structure frequencies have been increased.
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.game_info.nether: Owing to technical limitations with custom worlds, the Nether is not accessible as of now.
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.game_info.ites:
Ore blobs of all stone variants like DiorITE, GranITE and AndesITE are completely removed. Granite may still occur as part of copper ore veins.

This is done to reduce inventory clutter.
fetchr.lobby.tutorial.game_info.ambient:
There is a dimension setting in place that lets you see in the dark similarly to the vanilla nether.

This works without night vision, and you are still able to tell darkness apart from light to some degree.
fetchr.skybox.start_game.error.not_ready: Please wait for the pre-generation bar at the top to complete.
